text: i I think that there will be a three way
approach the first is resolving the
pending issues so be it the
contributions that the UK needs to pay
as a sort of exit clause there will be
pending dues that need to be paid how
much it will cost the UK to leave based
exactly and that's not how much it will
cost UK to have a relationship but how
much it will cost you Kate to leave
there will be issues relating to borders
especially the Irish issue which i think
is one of the most politically sensitive
issues that I think there is a political
willingness from everyone to have it
resolved it's only after those two areas
have been resolved that the third
negotiation will start which is what
type of new relationship would there be
between the UK and the European Union
the British Foreign Minister Boris
Johnson says we could in theory stay
inside the single market and but also
stop the freedom of movement so just
stop this idea that any EU citizen can
come move live and work I could in
theory when the hundred meters Olympic
race it's just not tapping no I think
all of us have been pretty clear in our
approach that we want a fair deal for
the UK but that sort of fair deal can
translate itself into a superior deal I
know that there is absolutely no
bluffing from the European side at least
the council meetings I have attended in
saying we will starting with this
position then we will soften up no this
is really and truly our position and I
don't see it to change it what sense are
you getting from the United Kingdom I
mean obviously you sat next to Teresa
may at dinner hard brexit soft brexit
what I mean what sense are you are you
getting I don't think it's an easy call
I think that
everyone is observing the sort of you
know toing and froing between hard and
soft and does it seem like a mess to you
in the UK to me it's hard to believe
that as someone who has studied in the
United Kingdom and to believe that the
British civil service doesn't have this
all sorted out
what's the impression of the government
in general I mean one has a sense and
Observer that attitudes are hardening in
the UK it's fair game to bash Brussels
and then you don't need to be surprised
if in Brussels they bash you back so
this is a bit of a catch-22 it won't be
a situation where one side gains and the
other side loses we are all going to
this to lose something but I don't see
and there will not be a situation where
the UK will have a better day than it
has today
and it simply cannot be but it will it
it will get complicated divorces are
never easy I think
